title: These 20 ‘left behind' stocks among the S&P 500 are expected to rise up to 59% over 12 months
text:
U.S. economy grew slightly faster 6.6% pace in second quarter, new GDP figures show

The U.S. grew a bit faster in the spring than previously estimated, but not enough to change the underlying growth trend in an economy that's recovered quite rapidly from the pandemic. See full story.

Best Buy CEO applauds workers who had to deal with ‘disrespectful' customers

Best Buy reported earnings and sales that beat expectations and raised its same-store sales outlook. See full story.

This could be Apple's next $20 billion business

Apple Inc. could turn advertising into its next $20 billion business as the company ramps up its offerings and clamps down on ad targeting by third parties. See full story.

Should you worry about breakthrough infections if you're vaccinated? Some precautions might be wise

While most hospitalizations and deaths occur in unvaccinated or partially vaccinated people, it might be smart to show some restraint in your activities. See full story.

MARKETWATCH PERSONAL FINANCE

'The COVID-19 pandemic reversed a predictable pattern in e-commerce, where consumers were generally able to purchase goods cheaper online,' according to the Adobe Digital Economy Index. See full story.
